## **Featured Survey Projects**

### **1. National Health Facility Assessment Tool**

::: {.project-card}
::: {.project-header}
#### üè• Comprehensive Facility Assessment - SurveyCTO
**Scale:** 500+ facilities | **Team:** 50 enumerators | **Duration:** 6 months
:::

::: {.project-body}
**Project Scope:**
- Comprehensive assessment of health facilities across 15 counties
- 350+ questions covering infrastructure, staffing, equipment, services
- GPS coordinates, facility photos, inventory counts
- Provider interviews and patient exit surveys

**Technical Implementation:**

**Survey Structure:**
- **Main Questionnaire:** 12 modules with complex skip logic
- **Repeat Groups:** Equipment inventory (50+ items), staff roster, service availability
- **Media Capture:** Photos of facilities, equipment, signage
- **GPS:** Automatic facility coordinates with accuracy checks
- **Quality Control:** Range checks, logical constraints, required fields

**Quality Assurance Features:**
```
# Key QC elements implemented:
- Real-time GPS validation (accuracy must be <10m)
- Photo requirements for critical equipment
- Automatic calculations (e.g., bed occupancy rate)
- Cross-validation across modules
- Daily data quality reports to supervisors
- Field-based data review before submission
```

**Field Operations:**
- 50 enumerators trained over 5 days
- Tablet-based data collection with offline capability
- Daily data synchronization at end of day
- Real-time monitoring dashboard for project managers
- Quality control spot checks (10% resurveys)

**Data Quality Results:**
- ‚úÖ 500+ facilities assessed
- ‚úÖ Data completeness: 98.7%
- ‚úÖ QC resurvey concordance: 96.3%
- ‚úÖ Zero devices lost or stolen
- ‚úÖ Average survey duration: 85 minutes (target: 90)

**Innovations:**
- Dynamic question text based on facility type
- Automated skip patterns reduced interview time by 25%
- Real-time data visualization for field teams
- Custom SMS alerts for data quality issues

**Technologies:** SurveyCTO, R for monitoring, Tableau dashboard

**Social Media Highlight:**
> "500 health facilities assessed in 6 months using mobile data collection! 50 enumerators, 98.7% data completeness, 96% quality on resurveys. This is how you scale health surveys in Africa! #MobileHealth #DataCollection #GlobalHealth"

### **2. Multi-Country Clinical Trial Database - REDCap**

::: {.project-card}
::: {.project-header}
#### üî¨ Complex Longitudinal Study Database
**Sites:** 12 | **Countries:** 4 | **Participants:** 1,200+
:::

::: {.project-body}
**Database Specifications:**

**Design Requirements:**
- Longitudinal design with 48-month follow-up
- 80+ data collection forms
- 15 repeating instruments (visits, adverse events, labs)
- Multi-language support (English, French, Swahili)
- Role-based access control for 100+ users
- Real-time data quality monitoring

**Form Categories:**
1. **Screening & Enrollment** (8 forms)
   - Eligibility checklist
   - Informed consent (electronic signature)
   - Demographics
   - Medical history

2. **Study Visits** (25 forms - repeating)
   - Clinical assessments
   - Laboratory requisitions
   - Medication dispensing
   - Adherence monitoring

3. **Adverse Events** (10 forms - repeating)
   - AE reporting
   - SAE expedited reporting
   - Causality assessment
   - Follow-up to resolution

4. **Laboratory** (15 forms)
   - Hematology, chemistry, immunology
   - Viral load, CD4 counts
   - Specimen tracking

5. **Study Management** (22 forms)
   - Protocol deviations
   - Query management
   - Close-out procedures

**Advanced Features Implemented:**

**1. Automated Calculations:**
```
# Example: BMI calculation
[bmi] = round([weight] / (([height]/100)^2), 1)

# Example: eGFR calculation (CKD-EPI)
if([sex]='Male',
  if([creatinine]<=0.9,
    141*([creatinine]/0.9)^(-0.411)*(0.993^[age]),
    141*([creatinine]/0.9)^(-1.209)*(0.993^[age])
  ),
  if([creatinine]<=0.7,
    144*([creatinine]/0.7)^(-0.329)*(0.993^[age]),
    144*([creatinine]/0.7)^(-1.209)*(0.993^[age])
  )
)
```

**2. Data Quality Rules:**
- 200+ validation rules and range checks
- Cross-form validations (e.g., dates consistency)
- Missing data alerts for required variables
- Logical inconsistency detection

**3. Automated Reporting:**
- Daily enrollment dashboard
- Weekly data quality metrics
- Monthly site performance reports
- Real-time SAE tracking
- Automated data queries

**4. API Integration:**
- Laboratory data import via API
- Randomization system integration
- Automated data exports for analysis
- External safety database connection

**User Management:**
- 12 sites with separate Data Access Groups
- 100+ users with role-based permissions
- Two-factor authentication enabled
- Detailed audit trail for all changes

**Project Outcomes:**
- ‚úÖ 1,200+ participants enrolled
- ‚úÖ 500,000+ data points captured
- ‚úÖ 99.7% data completeness
- ‚úÖ Query resolution time: 3.2 days average
- ‚úÖ Zero critical audit findings across 24 monitoring visits
- ‚úÖ FDA inspection ready at all times

**Technologies:** REDCap, R (REDCap API), SQL, Python

**Social Media Highlight:**

#### üö® Humanitarian Response Data Collection
**Context:** Flooding emergency | **Duration:** 3 weeks | **Households:** 2,000+

::: {.project-body}
**Emergency Context:**
- Severe flooding affecting 5 sub-counties
- Rapid needs assessment required within 2 weeks
- Limited infrastructure and connectivity
- Multi-sector assessment (health, WASH, shelter, food security)

**Survey Implementation:**

**Design Phase (Day 1-2):**
- Rapid tool adaptation from humanitarian standards
- 150 questions across 6 sectors
- Translation to Swahili and Dholuo
- Field testing and refinement

**Deployment (Day 3):**
- 30 enumerators trained in 1 day
- KoboCollect app deployed to tablets
- Offline data collection configured
- Quality control procedures established

**Data Collection (Day 4-14):**
- 2,000+ household surveys
- GPS coordinates and photos
- Daily data synchronization at base camp
- Real-time quality monitoring
- Preliminary analysis during collection

**Key Features:**
- Fully offline capable (no cellular coverage in affected areas)
- GPS validation to ensure geographic coverage
- Photo documentation of damage
- Automated skip logic reducing interview time
- Real-time dashboard for coordination team

**Rapid Analysis & Reporting (Day 15-21):**
- Automated cleaning and analysis scripts (R)
- GIS mapping of needs
- Priority scoring algorithm
- Sectoral needs reports
- Final presentation to humanitarian cluster

**Impact:**
- ‚úÖ 2,000+ households assessed in 11 days
- ‚úÖ Geographic coverage: 95% of affected areas
- ‚úÖ Data quality: 97% completeness
- ‚úÖ Rapid analysis enabled prioritization of interventions
- ‚úÖ Results presented to humanitarian cluster 3 days after data collection
- ‚úÖ Informed $2M emergency response allocation

**Technologies:** KoboCollect, R, QGIS, Leaflet

**Social Media Highlight:**

### **5. Patient-Reported Outcomes (PRO) System - REDCap**

::: {.project-card}
::: {.project-header}
#### üì± Direct Patient Data Capture via SMS and Web
**Participants:** 800+ | **Follow-up:** 12 months | **Response Rate:** 91%
:::

::: {.project-body}
**Innovation:**
- Direct patient data collection without clinic visits
- Multi-modal: SMS, web, and clinic tablets
- Automated reminders and follow-up
- Integration with clinical database

**System Architecture:**

**1. Survey Delivery Channels:**
- **SMS:** Short surveys via Twilio integration
- **Web:** REDCap survey links via email
- **Tablet:** In-clinic completion for patients without phones
- **USSD:** Basic phone support (pilot)

**2. Automated Workflows:**
```
Patient Enrollment
    ‚Üì
Survey Schedule Created
    ‚Üì
[Monthly Survey Trigger]
    ‚Üì
1. SMS invitation sent ‚Üí Complete via SMS
2. Email with link sent ‚Üí Complete via web
3. Reminder after 3 days ‚Üí Escalate to phone call
4. Clinic visit scheduled ‚Üí Complete on tablet
    ‚Üì
Data Integration ‚Üí Clinical Dashboard
```

**3. Survey Content:**
- Medication adherence (Morisky scale)
- Symptom monitoring
- Side effects assessment
- Quality of life (EQ-5D)
- Healthcare utilization

**Technical Implementation:**
- REDCap surveys with mobile-responsive design
- Twilio API for SMS delivery and collection
- Automated reminder system
- Real-time alerts for concerning responses
- Dashboard for clinical team

**Patient Experience:**
- Average completion time: 5 minutes
- Multiple language options
- Offline web version available
- Help desk support

**Clinical Integration:**
- PRO data visible in clinician dashboard
- Alerts for concerning symptoms (e.g., side effects)
- Trend analysis for individual patients
- Aggregated insights for program improvement

**Results:**

- ‚úÖ 91% monthly response rate (target: 80%)
- ‚úÖ 72% complete via SMS (preferred method)
- ‚úÖ Early detection of 156 adverse events
- ‚úÖ Medication adherence improved from 74% to 86%
- ‚úÖ Patient satisfaction: 94%

## **Survey Design Best Practices**

### **My Design Approach**

::: {.skills-grid}
::: {.skill-category}
#### üìù Questionnaire Design
- Start with validated instruments when available
- Cognitive interviewing for new questions
- Keep surveys as short as possible
- Logical flow and grouping
- Plain language, culturally appropriate
:::

::: {.skill-category}
#### üîß Technical Implementation
- Use appropriate data types
- Implement validation rules
- Smart skip logic to reduce burden
- Calculate fields to reduce errors
- Test extensively before deployment
:::

::: {.skill-category}
#### üë• User Experience
- Mobile-first design
- Offline capability when needed
- Clear instructions and help text
- Progress indicators
- Minimal scrolling/navigation
:::

::: {.skill-category}
#### ‚úÖ Quality Assurance
- Automated validation rules
- Range checks for numeric data
- Required fields (judiciously)
- Real-time quality monitoring
- Regular data quality reports
:::
:::
